title: BBC Local Live: Greater Manchester and east Cheshire on Thursday 2 February 2017 - BBC News
summary: attempted murder arrest over stockport hotel shooting .
rough sleepers hub in £ 4.5m city centre investment plan .
stockport mp anne coffey voted against the article 50 bill .
anti-semitic incidents in greater manchester fall by 9 % .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from greater manchester and east cheshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on friday with more news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .

documents.title: weather : mild night with outbreaks of rain
text: it should stay mild tonight , but rather windy and often cloudy with outbreaks of rain .
through the early hours skies will gradually clear , meaning it should turn colder .

text: a man has appeared in court charged with the murder of his wife .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: mental health and stigma : 'be there to listen '
text: the stigma around mental health problems can have a devastating impact on people 's lives , a survey has found .
lauren quigley , 26 , a college learning facilitator from manchester who was diagnosed with depression and anxiety tells her story .
`` my partner - and first love - was working in france .
i had been struggling with the distance and my mind had started whirring with negative thoughts . ''
she knew my history but thought it was in my past .
a week before i was due to fly out to see her , she broke up with me over skype and i blamed myself entirely for the split .
`` i 'm very lucky to have a new partner now .
she finds it really hard to fully understand my problems but she 's read up on anxiety .
`` it 's about being there to listen - not judge . ''

documents.title: calls to address government gender pay gap
text: the mp for bury north has told the government to get its own house in order before telling business to close the pay gap between men and women .

david nuttall , who is himself a conservative , told ministers they should take more action internally after it was revealed there was a 13 % difference in pay between men and women working in government departments .
that is still better than average gender pay gap for wages across the country - which stands at 18 % .
the government said they were working to eliminate the gap .
responding for the government , education minister caroline dinenage said they were working to eliminate the gap .

documents.title: lowry statue in for repairs
text: tameside highways have confirmed that the l.s lowry statue in mottram has not been stolen , it has been sent away to be repaired following vandalism .
it is expected to be returned in two weeks .

maybe not your hopes , dreams and darkest secrets

documents.title: karen danczuk wants to shed 'selfie queen ' image to help abuse victims
text: karen danczuk has said she wants to shed her `` selfie queen '' image in favour of helping victims of sexual abuse .
the ex-councillor , who was raped by her brother , has become a patron of the national association for people abused in childhood .
ms danczuk found fame posting self-portraits on twitter - though she now believes these were a `` cry for help '' .
she said she hopes to use her media profile to help remove the `` stigma '' suffered by abuse victims .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: meet the longford lover
text: he is the notorious womaniser and fan of 'latchford ladies ' , who also brought some of the twentieth century 's most iconic bands to warrington .
chris culleton said it was a couple of policemen who gave him his memorable nickname .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: fred talbot to stand trial over indecency charges
text: former tv weather presenter fred talbot is to stand trial accused of indecently assaulting teenage boys on school trips in scotland .
he is also accused of lewd practices towards a boy aged 12 on a trip .
the incidents are alleged to have happened on camping trips in moffat and boating trips on the caledonian canal in inverness .
talbot , 67 , of greater manchester , has denied the offences .
at lanark sheriff court a trial date was set for 15 may .

documents.title: frank lampard 'greatly enjoyed ' playing at manchester city
text: former england and chelsea midfielder frank lampard has said he `` greatly enjoyed '' his last playing years at manchester city and new york city as he announced his retirement , bringing to an end a 21-year professional career .
lampard , who played for city in 2014 , made 649 appearances for chelsea and won 106 england caps .

whilst i have received a number of exciting offers to continue playing , at 38 i feel now is the time to begin the next chapter in my life , '' said lampard in his retirement statement on social media .
it was an incredible career when you consider he was written off right at the start and told he might not go that far .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: leigh mp to introduce bill for inquest funding for grieving families
text: a bill is to be introduced to the house of commons by leigh mp andy burnham , who is campaigning for grieving families to be given legal costs when going through inquests .
he said he wanted to secure more accountability of public bodies and equal funding for bereaved families at inquests .
he has been campaigning for a `` hillsborough bill '' following the inquests into the deaths of 96 football fans , which concluded they were unlawfully killed .

text: sir bradley wiggins insists he does not consider himself a favourite and is not fussed about winning '' as he gears up for celebrity winter sports contest the jump .

documents.title: man wanted on prison recall
text: police are searching for a wanted man from miles platting .
joshua birkett , 22 , of bradford road , is wanted on recall to prison after failing to comply with the terms of his licence .
as well as miles platting , he has links to the ancoats , openshaw , beswick and collyhurst areas of manchester , police said .

documents.title: developer wants to open a george best themed hotel in manchester
text: a hotel developer and operator has revealed plans to open a george best themed football hotel in manchester .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: anti-semitic hate crime : 'individuals targeted ' in greater manchester
text: anti-semitic incidents in greater manchester are more likely to involve `` random street racism '' against individuals rather than organisations , according to the community security trust charity .
figures showed a 9 % fall in the number of recorded incidents in the region compared to an increase of more than a third nationally .
ideologically motivated anti-semitism , which normally takes the form of hate mail , abusive phone calls or anti-semitic graffiti , tends to be concentrated in greater london , the study found .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: police arrest 11 people in north manchester raids
text: a total of 11 people have been arrested in dawn raids in north manchester in a police operation against organised crime .
officers went to a number of addresses in miles platting and ancoats this morning as part of a crackdown on suspected drug dealers .
police say the raids were in response to information from the public .

documents.title: teens represent gb at underwater hockey championships
text: two rochdale teenagers have been chosen to represent great britain in the underwater hockey world championships in tasmania .
zach tate , 18 , ( and becci northover go to hobart in july .
they train at the pool at oulder hill leisure centre in rochdale .

documents.title: football : man utd manager says rules 'different ' for him
text: manchester united manager jose mourinho says he is being judged by different rules to other premier league bosses .
the portuguese appeared to be frustrated by the performance of referee mike jones during wednesday 's 0-0 draw with hull at old trafford .
and mourinho highlighted liverpool manager jurgen klopp 's exchange with fourth official neil swarbrick during their 1-1 draw with chelsea on tuesday .
you know clearly i am different .
the rules for me are different
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: £ 4.5m city centre improvements planned
text: plans to invest £ 4.5m in improving manchester city centre will be discussed by councillors next week .
a survey found that people identified litter , anti-social behaviour and homelessness as major issues which they wanted the council to deal with .
ideas include a campaign to target littering and creating a so-called emergency hub to help rough sleepers .

documents.title: just two choices in consultation over libraries as closures loom
text: library users and community groups raised concerns at a bury council cabinet meeting , as councillors passed a motion to cement plans to close the majority of the borough 's libraries .
author: Bury Times

documents.title: attempted murder arrest over hotel shooting
text: a man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a woman was shot in a hotel in stockport .
the 46-year-old was found with serious abdominal wounds at the britannia hotel in dialstone lane in offerton on tuesday .
she was taken to hospital where she remains in a serious but stable condition .
a 47-year-old man is being questioned in police custody .
police believe it was `` an isolated incident '' and continued to appeal for information .

documents.title: breakingman arrested over hotel shooting
text: a 47-year-old man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a woman was shot in a hotel in stockport , greater manchester police said .
more to follow .

documents.title: football : man city boss pep guardiola compares brazilian to watermelon
text: manchester city 's signing of gabriel jesus was like buying a watermelon , said pep guardiola after the brazilian teenager 's first goal for the club .
the 19-year-old , who joined from palmeiras , scored one and assisted another on his first premier league start as city thrashed west ham 4-0 .
you never know .
it 's like a watermelon .
you have to open to see if it 's good or not .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: huge drugs stash seized
text: police seized nearly half a million pounds worth of drugs in shaw .
author: Oldham Evening Chronicle
Oldham Evening Chronicle

documents.title: mps vote in favour of article 50 bill
text: stockport mp anne coffey and manchester withington 's jeff smith were among 47 labour mps who defied party leader jeremy corbyn and voted against the article 50 bill , allowing ministers to trigger brexit , despite strict party orders .
mps voted overwhelmingly in favour of triggering article 50 in the commons last night .
the government will set out its plans to take britain out of the eu in a white paper published later .

documents.title: man united 0-0 hull city
text: eldin jakupovic made a string of fine saves as hull frustrated manchester united by claiming a goalless draw in the premier league at old trafford .

the hosts dominated the match but could not find a way past the tigers goalkeeper , who brilliantly kept out zlatan ibrahimovic 's long-range strike and paul pogba 's driving effort in the first half .
full match report here .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: more than 200 anti-semitic incidents recorded in greater manchester
text: there has been a slight fall in the number of anti-semitic incidents in greater manchester over the last year , according to the charity , the community security trust , which monitors abuse against jewish people .
it says there were 205 reports in 2016 , a drop of 9 % from the previous year .
that contrasts starkly with an increase nationally of more than a third - with 1,309 reported incidents - an all time high
more than three-quarters of all recorded incidents across the uk took place in greater manchester and greater london , where the two largest jewish communities are located .

documents.title: west ham united 0- 4 manchester city
text: gabriel jesus scored his first manchester city goal as they tore west ham apart at london stadium .
city beat the hammers 4-0 , with goals also from de bruyne , silva , and toure .
that win keeps city in 5th spot , but they are now level with liverpool in 4th and only one point behind spurs in second .
author: BBC Sport
